social_media_optimization.youtube:
A Very Noisy Night | Bedtime Story for Kids | Overcoming Fear of the Dark ğŸ­ 

Join Little Mouse and Big Mouse in this heartwarming tale about night noises and finding comfort. 

#KidsStory #ReadAloud #BedtimeStory #PictureBook #Animation

video_description.en: In this cozy bedtime story, Little Mouse can't sleep because of all the strange noises in the night. How will Big Mouse help him overcome his fears? A heartwarming tale about trust, companionship, and conquering imaginary fears. If you enjoy this story, please like and subscribe for more!

cover_image_prompt: Reference the character and scene from the images generated above, maintain consistency, A cozy bedroom inside a burrow, the large mouse in a red sleeping cap is reading a book in a big bed, while the small mouse in blue striped pajamas is sitting up in a tiny bed looking wide awake and nervous, warm lantern light, shadows in the corners, title text
in the center with stylized cute font, masterpiece, 8k resolution --ar 16:9

in the center with stylized English font, masterpiece, 8k resolution --ar 16:9

script.eng_narration: It was late, and the forest was quiet. Big Mouse tucked Little Mouse into his cozy little bed and whispered, 'Goodnight, Little Mouse.' Little Mouse pulled up his yellow blanket, but his eyes were wide open.
script.image_prompt: Reference the character and scene from the images generated above, maintain consistency, the small mouse in blue striped pajamas in the little bed, the large mouse in a red sleeping cap standing beside him tucking him in, 4-panel storyboard sequence, 2x2 grid layout. Panel 1: Pure black screen, void, no content. Panel 2: The large mouse gently pulling the blanket up for the small mouse, warm lighting. Panel 3: The large mouse walking away towards his big bed, waving goodnight. Panel 4: Close up of the small mouse lying in bed, eyes wide open, looking alert. Seamless collage, split screen display, no text other than numbers --ar 16:9 --no split screen border, white margins, black bars, padding, extra text, text watermark, artist name, photorealistic, hyper-realistic, harsh shadows
script.video_prompt: The video should be an animated sequence based on the 4-panel storyboard (ignoring the first black panel). ACTION SEQUENCE (Describe in English): Shot 1: The large mouse gently tucks the blanket around the small mouse. Camera: Medium shot. Shot 2: The large mouse walks away to his own bed. Camera: Wide shot. Shot 3: Close up on the small mouse's face, blinking, looking left and right, unable to sleep. Camera: Close-up. VIDEO SETTINGS: Smooth transitions between shots. No dialogue. No narration. No BGM.

script.eng_narration: Big Mouse had just settled into his big bed to read when he heard Little Mouse cry out, 'Big Mouse, Big Mouse! There's something fluttering at the window!'
script.image_prompt: Reference the character and scene from the images generated above, maintain consistency, the bedroom scene, 4-panel storyboard sequence, 2x2 grid layout. Panel 1: Pure black screen, void, no content. Panel 2: The large mouse lying in the big bed with a book, looking surprised. Panel 3: The small mouse sitting up in the little bed, pointing fearfully at the round window. Panel 4: A view of the window with a dark shadow shape outside. Seamless collage, split screen display, no text other than numbers --ar 16:9 --no split screen border, white margins, black bars, padding, extra text, text watermark, artist name, photorealistic, hyper-realistic, harsh shadows
script.video_prompt: The video should be an animated sequence based on the 4-panel storyboard (ignoring the first black panel). ACTION SEQUENCE (Describe in English): Shot 1: The large mouse lowers his book, looking towards the small mouse. Camera: Medium shot. Shot 2: The small mouse sits up abruptly, pointing at the window, trembling slightly. Camera: Medium shot. Shot 3: Focus on the window, a vague shadow moves past it. Camera: POV shot from the small mouse's perspective. VIDEO SETTINGS: Smooth transitions between shots. No dialogue. No narration. No BGM.

script.eng_narration: Big Mouse sighed, put down his book, and walked to the window. 'Don't worry, Little Mouse,' he reassured him, 'It's just the wind blowing the ivy leaves against the glass.'
script.image_prompt: Reference the character and scene from the images generated above, maintain consistency, the large mouse checking the window, 4-panel storyboard sequence, 2x2 grid layout. Panel 1: Pure black screen, void, no content. Panel 2: The large mouse standing by the window, looking out. Panel 3: Close up of ivy leaves tapping against the glass outside. Panel 4: The large mouse turning back to smile and comfort the small mouse. Seamless collage, split screen display, no text other than numbers --ar 16:9 --no split screen border, white margins, black bars, padding, extra text, text watermark, artist name, photorealistic, hyper-realistic, harsh shadows
script.video_prompt: The video should be an animated sequence based on the 4-panel storyboard (ignoring the first black panel). ACTION SEQUENCE (Describe in English): Shot 1: The large mouse peers out the window. Camera: Medium shot. Shot 2: Close up of the ivy leaves swaying in the wind and tapping the glass. Camera: Close-up. Shot 3: The large mouse turns around and gestures calmly to the small mouse. Camera: Medium shot. VIDEO SETTINGS: Smooth transitions between shots. No dialogue. No narration. No BGM.

script.eng_narration: Little Mouse lay back down and tried to close his eyes. But a moment later, he heard a new sound. 'Hoo-hoo... Hoo-hoo...' It sounded spooky. 'Big Mouse!' he squeaked, 'There must be a monster on the roof!'
script.image_prompt: Reference the character and scene from the images generated above, maintain consistency, the small mouse scared in bed, 4-panel storyboard sequence, 2x2 grid layout. Panel 1: Pure black screen, void, no content. Panel 2: The small mouse pulling the blanket up to his nose, eyes darting around. Panel 3: The small mouse shouting towards the big bed, looking terrified. Panel 4: The large mouse sitting up in bed again, looking tired but patient. Seamless collage, split screen display, no text other than numbers --ar 16:9 --no split screen border, white margins, black bars, padding, extra text, text watermark, artist name, photorealistic, hyper-realistic, harsh shadows

Camera: Medium shot. Shot 3: The large mouse rubs his eyes and sits up in the big bed. Camera: Medium shot. VIDEO SETTINGS: Smooth transitions between shots. No dialogue. No narration. No BGM.

script.eng_narration: Big Mouse climbed out of bed and listened carefully. 'That's not a monster, Little Mouse,' he said gently. 'That is an owl singing in the treetops. He is just saying goodnight to us.'
script.image_prompt: Reference the character and scene from the images generated above, maintain consistency, the large mouse explaining, 4-panel storyboard sequence, 2x2 grid layout. Panel 1: Pure black screen, void, no content. Panel 2: The large mouse standing in the middle of the room, hand to ear listening. Panel 3: An imagined thought bubble showing a cute owl on a branch hooting. Panel 4: The large mouse tucking the small mouse in again. Camera: Static shot. Shot 3: The large mouse smooths the blanket over the small mouse. Camera: Close-up. VIDEO SETTINGS: Smooth transitions between shots. No dialogue. No narration. No BGM.

script.eng_narration: The room fell silent again. This time, Little Mouse was determined to sleep. But then... 'Drip, drip.' The sound was faint, but in the quiet night, it was crystal clear. Little Mouse curled up into a ball, terrified.
script.image_prompt: Reference the character and scene from the images generated above, maintain consistency, silence then a new noise, 4-panel storyboard sequence, 2x2 grid layout. Panel 1: Pure black screen, void, no content. Panel 2: The room is dark and quiet, peaceful atmosphere. Panel 3: Close up of the small mouse's ear twitching. Panel 4: The small mouse curled up tightly under the yellow blanket, only ears visible. Camera: Extreme close-up. Shot 3: The small mouse pulls the blanket completely over his head, shivering. Camera: Medium shot. VIDEO SETTINGS: Smooth transitions between shots. No dialogue. No narration. No BGM.

script.eng_narration: 'Big Mouse!' Little Mouse cried out, his voice trembling. 'This time it must be a ghost knocking at the door!' Big Mouse let out a long sigh, rubbed his sleepy eyes, and got out of bed.
script.image_prompt: Reference the character and scene from the images generated above, maintain consistency, the small mouse crying out, 4-panel storyboard sequence, 2x2 grid layout. Panel 3: The large mouse sitting on the edge of the big bed, shoulders slumped, very tired. Panel 4: The large mouse putting on his slippers. Shot 3: The large mouse slowly stands up, stretching his back. Camera: Wide shot. VIDEO SETTINGS: Smooth transitions between shots. No dialogue. No narration. No BGM.

script.eng_narration: Big Mouse walked to the washstand in the corner of the room. 'There are no ghosts, Little Mouse,' he said, tightening the tap. 'It was just a leaky faucet dripping water.' The dripping sound stopped.

Panel 4: The large mouse smiling back at the small mouse reassuringly. script.eng_narration: Little Mouse scratched his head, feeling a bit silly. Big Mouse returned to his big bed, pulled up his quilt, and said, 'Now, it really is time to sleep. Quietly sleep.'

script.eng_narration: The room was pitch black. Little Mouse lay in his little bed. It was so quiet that he felt lonely. He tossed and turned, and the bed creaked 'Squeak.' He turned again, 'Squeak.'
script.image_prompt: Reference the character and scene from the images generated above, maintain consistency, the small mouse restless in the dark, 4-panel storyboard sequence, 2x2 grid layout. Panel 1: Pure black screen, void, no content. Panel 2: Dark room, the small mouse's eyes wide open in the dark. Panel 3: The small mouse tossing to the left. Panel 4: The small mouse tossing to the right, looking unhappy. Shot 3: He rolls to the other side, looking at the big bed. Camera: Medium shot. VIDEO SETTINGS: Smooth transitions between shots. No dialogue. No narration. No BGM.

script.eng_narration: Now he really couldn't stand it. Clutching his little pillow, he tiptoed out of bed and ran to the side of Big Mouse's bed. 'Big Mouse...' he whispered.
script.image_prompt: Reference the character and scene from the images generated above, maintain consistency, the small mouse moving to the big bed, 4-panel storyboard sequence, 2x2 grid layout. Panel 4: The small mouse standing beside the big bed, looking up at the sleeping large mouse. Shot 3: He stands by the big bed and gently pokes the large mouse. Camera: Medium shot. VIDEO SETTINGS: Smooth transitions between shots. No dialogue. No narration. No BGM.

script.eng_narration: Big Mouse groggily opened one eye. 'What is it now, Little Mouse?' Little Mouse said pitifully, 'My bed is too lonely. Can I sleep with you?'
script.image_prompt: Reference the character and scene from the images generated above, maintain consistency, conversation at the big bed, 4-panel storyboard sequence, 2x2 grid layout. Panel 4: The large mouse lifting the corner of his quilt. Shot 3: The large mouse smiles sleepily and lifts the blanket. Camera: Medium shot. VIDEO SETTINGS: Smooth transitions between shots. No dialogue. No narration. No BGM.

script.eng_narration: Big Mouse scooted over, making a warm little spot for Little Mouse. 'Alright, hop in.' Little Mouse immediately scrambled in. It was warm and safe.

script.eng_narration: Little Mouse sighed happily and fell asleep instantly. But now, it was Big Mouse who couldn't sleep. Little Mouse's feet were kicking his tummy, and little snores were buzzing right in his ear.

Panel 4: The small mouse's foot kicking the large mouse's stomach lightly. script.eng_narration: Big Mouse listened to the wind in the leaves, the distant song of the owl, and the steady breathing of Little Mouse. He smiled. It certainly was a bit of a noisy night.

script.eng_narration: But as long as they were together, a little noise didn't matter. Soon, both Big Mouse and Little Mouse drifted into sweet dreams. Goodnight, Big Mouse. Goodnight, Little Mouse.
